CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 26, 1953, pg. 2, reads: "107th Birthday - Mrs. Sabra [Sabre] Washington, who was born a slave, and who celebrated her 107th birthday here Sunday with her neighbors in her home at 8141 Conemaugh Street, is shown as she waves Christmas greetings to the world for the 107th time. - Harris Photo."Cutline for image published after the fact in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Pittsburgh's Oldest Woman Succumbs - Mrs. Sabre Washington, known as "Mother" to her many friends, died at the age of 113 last Friday. The ex-slave was born on a plantation near Nicholson, S. C., but had lived in Pittsburgh for many years.  The above pictures were taken before she was taken to the John J. Kane Hospital a few months ago where she died...In the second photo she is pictured hanging a Christmas wreath... - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington, standing at window with Christmas wreath, on her 107th birthday, in her home on Conemaugh Street
